common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Connectivity Issues in Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces Copilot from VS Code in remote environments like WSL2 and Docker containers.  The issues often involve network connectivity problems, specifically with Pieces OS listening on the loopback interface. Solutions include ensuring Pieces OS listens on all interfaces, configuring custom URLs in VS Code settings, and using the 'host.docker.internal' resolution for Docker environments.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* The issue involves network connectivity problems within WSL2, preventing proper Copilot rendering.
* The author (@hra42) suggests exploring potential solutions:
    * Systemd option
    * dns-tunnel
* The reporter (@robert-at-pieces) clarifies:
    * Systemd is already enabled.
    * dns-tunnel hasn't been tested.
    * Suspects the issue might be snap installation related.

**Problems Identified:**

* Network connectivity issues within WSL2.
* Copilot rendering failure due to network problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Systemd option is enabled.
* dns-tunnel hasn't been tested yet.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The investigation is ongoing.
* Suspicion of snap installation related issue.

**Next Steps:**

* Test the dns-tunnel solution.
* Investigate the possibility of a snap installation related issue.
* Update the ticket with further findings.

I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? This summary captures the essential points of the conversation and highlights the problem, proposed solutions, and the final resolution.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* **Context issue:** Gemini was not including a specific .py file in the context, causing it to ask for the file repeatedly.
* **Line number wrapping issue:** Line numbers in code responses were wrapping incorrectly.

**Problems identified:**

* Bug in Gemini preventing proper context inclusion of specific files.
* Incorrect line number formatting in code responses.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Fix for the context issue will be included in the upcoming release 11.0.4.
* Investigation and potential fix for the line number wrapping issue are ongoing.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Context issue resolved and will be released in the next update.
* Line number wrapping issue still under investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The team appreciates user feedback and encourages reporting any further bugs encountered.

## GitHub Issue Summary: 
**Problem:** Users experiencing issues using the "Pieces" product, including:

  - invalidated OpenAI API keys causing failures.
  - potential issues with "Claude" and "Gemini" models (as of December 30, 2024).

**Proposed solutions:**

 - Remove OpenAI API key (confirmed as working by a user on 2025-01-14).
 - Switch model to "GPT4o" if using "Claude" or "Gemini" and experiencing difficulties (suggested on December 30, 2024).
 - Ensure updates and sign-in for higher rate limit (suggested on January 6, 2025).
 - OpenAI models recommended due to issues with "Claude" + "Gemini" service (January 6, 2025 update).

**Current Status:**

   - OpenAI model recommendation as the primary solution (January 6, 2025).
 - API key registration process unclear after initial removal (addressed by mark-at-pieces on Jan. 14).

   **Further investigation needed regarding OpenAI API registration.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High Resource Usage
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage with PiecesOS, sometimes reaching 100%, especially when using Live Context. This might be linked to internet connectivity or memory leaks. Temporary solutions include restarting PiecesOS or using the "Optimize Memory" button. The Pieces team is actively working on a permanent fix.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue on POS Memory Usage 

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing high memory and CPU usage with POS, particularly when using the Live Context feature. 
* Memory usage can be as high as 5GB for some users. 
* Users report that the Optimize Memory button does not permanently solve the issue.
* Some users are experiencing high CPU usage with POS.

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leaks are causing POS to use excessive resources.
* On-device ML processing is resource-intensive, leading to high memory and CPU usage.
* The Live Context feature contributes to increased resource consumption. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on improving the performance of POS and reducing resource consumption.
* A "Optimize Memory" button has been implemented to unload some ML models and free up RAM.
* The team is investigating the memory leak issue and developing solutions to address it. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is ongoing, with the Pieces team actively working on improvements. 
* The "Optimize Memory" button can provide temporary relief. 
* High memory and CPU usage continue to be a concern for some users. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The team is committed to resolving these issues and making POS a more efficient and user-friendly platform.
* Users can contact the Pieces team for individual assistance if experiencing excessive resource usage.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces Copilot connectivity issues:** This recurring issue causes significant user frustration, especially in remote environments. Focus on ensuring seamless Copilot access across various setups (WSL2, Docker, etc.).

**Investigate and address Pieces Copilot unresponsiveness and errors:** Analyze reported cases with specific file types or large codebases to identify root causes. Optimize Copilot's performance and resource handling.

**Address PiecesOS high resource usage:** Investigate memory leaks and optimize Live Context functionality to reduce RAM/CPU consumption. Provide clear communication to users about ongoing efforts and temporary workarounds.
**Improve Desktop Application stability:** Address reported bugs like eager saving of conversation titles and repetitive welcome messages to enhance user experience.
**Review and update documentation:** Ensure that support articles and FAQs effectively address common issues like Copilot connectivity problems and provide clear instructions for troubleshooting.
**Consider enhancing error messaging:** Provide more informative error messages to users, enabling them to understand the problem and potentially resolve it themselves.

**Gather more data on less active issues:** While focusing on the most frequent issues, systematically gather information about less common problems to identify potential trends and underlying causes.
**Monitor the effectiveness of implemented solutions:** Track the impact of bug fixes and improvements on user-reported issues to ensure their effectiveness and identify any regressions.
